New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers outrebounded Oklahoma City Thunder 40-38
Key Match Events: Oklahoma City Thunder forced 15 turnovers and got 9 steals
Donovan Mitchell shot 3-of-16 from the field on the way to 11 points
Cleveland Cavaliers made 41.7 percent from 3-point range on 36 attempts
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder will play the Cavs at home on Jan. 16
The matchup next week at Paycom Center could bring a different dynamic between the Thunder's top-rated defense and the Cavs' top-rated offense
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored a game-high 31 points but didn't get all his ideal 3-point looks
The Thunder struggled in rebounding, which hurt them in the Western Conference semifinals loss to the Dallas Mavericks last year
Miscellaneous Highlights: Many want to see more of the Thunder-Cavs matchup (perhaps in the NBA Finals)
David Aldridge of The Athletic requested a seven-game series between them
Old-time Boston Globe writer Bob Ryan declared Thunder-Cavs to be 'basketball as it should be'
